oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EVALUATION OF BEACH MODELLING TECHNIQUES BEHIND DETACHED BREAKWATERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Axe, Philip
Ilic, Suzana
Chadwick, Andrew
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: beach modeling
modeling technique
breakwater
detached breakwater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents an evaluation of current design formulae for beach response to multiple breakwaters, comparing the predictions of the design guidelines with observations of beach response made during the large scale field experiment carried out at Elmer, on the UK south coast. The introduction describes typical shoreline response to breakwaters, the forcing mechanisms responsible and the characteristics of macro-tidal beaches. The remainder of the paper presents the empirical design tools, and the results of the evaluation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
